instruction: What kinds of spectrum (reflectance or absorbance) were used to evaluate the hyperspectral response of water-stress induced lettuce using artificial neural networks (ANN)?
Output: Both reflectance and absorbance measurements were used to evaluate the hyperspectral response of water-stress induced lettuce using artificial neural networks (ANN).

instruction: What metric was chosen to measure the accuracy of the ANN approach in detecting water stress in lettuce plants, and how accurate was it?
Output: The metric chosen to measure the accuracy of the ANN approach in detecting water stress in lettuce plants was not explicitly mentioned in the given text. instruction: Can the ANN approach applied to hyperspectral data be used to detect early stages of water stress in lettuce plants with higher accuracy compared to traditional methods?
Output: Yes, the ANN approach applied to hyperspectral data can be used to detect early stages of water stress in lettuce plants with higher accuracy compared to traditional methods. The article states that the ANN approach was able to separate the water-stressed lettuce from the non-stressed group with up to 80% accuracy at the beginning of the experiment, and this accuracy improved to up to 93% at the end of the experiment. The study also found that absorbance data offered better accuracy than reflectance data for modeling water stress in lettuce plants. Therefore, the ANN approach using hyperspectral data shows promise for accurately detecting early stages of water stress in lettuce plants.
